newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Wing Tai hits new year low.
newsitem.headline: Wing Tai hits new year low.

text.p: Shares in Singapore property company Wing Tai Holdings Ltd fell eight cents to a new year low of Singapore $3.82 on Monday.
At 0735 GMT, the shares were around S$3.84, with more than one million shares traded.
Dealers said Wing Tai shares were suffering from a general bearish market sentiment but the stock remains a buy, said ING Baring assistant director Lim Chung Chun.
"I believe Wing Tai will perform well relative to the Singapore property sector," Lim told Reuters.
Lim said he expected Wing Tai to post good earnings for the next three to four years based on projects under way.
"The projects, like those in Hong Kong and Singapore's Bukit Timah, are on comfortable profit margins," Lim said.
He said its two projects along Bukit Timah, a prime residential area in central Singapore, could fetch 30-40 percent more than current market prices.
"So even if prices were to fall, Wing Tai can achieve decent profit margins," Lim said.
Other analysts said they were cautious about calling a buy on the stock given Singapore's weaker property market after the government's April 12 move to curtail public housing subsidies.
"We can expect more bad news on the sector as the over-supply situation mounts," said another analyst.
